alert.note: Alert for Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 23 at 11:02AM CDT until April 06 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Missouri...Tennessee... Arkansas...Mississippi... Mississippi River Above Tiptonville Mississippi River at Osceola Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THURSDAY, APRIL 06... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing. * WHEN...From this morning to Thursday, April 06. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, The south evacuation road from Whiskey and Bordeaux Islands is going underwater. In Mississippi, roads to Bordeaux Point area are beginning to flood. Campsites on the south side of Flower Lake are being covered. Parts of the road to Stubb`s Island are flooded. In Arkansas, the lowest access road to fields inside the Arkansas Levee south of Horseshoe Lake is flooded. The evacuation road from Peters Island is covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.0 feet Tuesday, April 04. - Action stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
